001package io.github.ai4ci.util;
002
003import java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException;
004import java.lang.reflect.Method;
005import java.util.Arrays;
006import java.util.stream.Collectors;
007import java.util.stream.Stream;
008
009import com.fasterxml.jackson.annotation.JsonProperty;
010
011import io.github.ai4ci.flow.output.OutputWriter.Writeable;
012
013/**
014 * Utility class for converting objects to CSV format.
015 * <p>
016 * This class provides functionality to transform objects annotated with
017 * {@link JsonProperty} into CSV rows with appropriate escaping for CSV special
018 * characters. The transformation follows the standard CSV format specification
019 * where fields may be quoted if they contain commas, quotes, or newlines.
020 * <p>
021 * Each property value is sanitised according to the following rules:
022 * <ul>
023 * <li>Null values are represented as "NA"</li>
024 * <li>Strings containing commas, quotes, or newlines are quoted</li>
025 * <li>Quotes within strings are escaped by doubling them</li>
026 * </ul>
027 *
028 * @param <X> the type of objects to be serialised, must implement Writeable
029 *            interface
030 * @author Rob Challen
031 * @see com.fasterxml.jackson.annotation.JsonProperty
032 * @see io.github.ai4ci.flow.output.OutputWriter.Writeable
033 */
034public class CSVUtil<X extends Writeable> {
035
036        /**
037         * Generates a CSV-formatted string from an array of objects.
038         * <p>
039         * This static method converts individual values to CSV format and
040         * concatenates them with comma separators.
041         *
042         * @param objects the objects to convert to CSV format
043         * @return a CSV-formatted string of the input objects
044         */
045        public static String csvFrom(Object... objects) {
046                StringBuilder s = new StringBuilder();
047                boolean sep = false;
048                for (Object o : objects) {
049                        s.append((sep ? "," : "") + csvString(o));
050                        sep = true;
051                }
052                return s.toString();
053        }
054
055        /**
056         * Sanitises an individual object value for CSV format.
057         * <p>
058         * This method applies the following rules to convert an object to a
059         * CSV-compatible string:
060         * <ul>
061         * <li>Null values are represented as "NA"</li>
062         * <li>Strings containing commas, quotes, or newlines are enclosed in double
063         * quotes</li>
064         * <li>Double quotes within strings are escaped by doubling them</li>
065         * <li>Non-string objects are converted to their string representation</li>
066         * </ul>
067         *
068         * @param object the object to sanitise for CSV format
069         * @return the sanitised CSV value as a string
070         */
071        private static String csvString(Object object) {
072                if (object == null) return "NA";
073                if (object instanceof String) {
074                        String value = (String) object;
075                        if (value.contains(",") || value.contains("\"")
076                                        || value.contains("\n")) {
077                                value = value.replace("\"", "\"\"");
078                                return "\"" + value + "\"";
079                        }
080                        return value;
081                }
082                return object.toString();
083        }
084
085        // TODO: Use of reflection for creating CSV files involves performance hit.
086        // See @Data immutables annotation and commented out code here
087        // Datatype<X> dt;
088        Class<X> type;
089
090        Method[] methods;
091
092        /**
093         * Constructs a new CSVUtil instance for the specified class.
094         * <p>
095         * The constructor initialises the utility by scanning all methods annotated
096         * with {@link JsonProperty} in the provided class. These methods are used to
097         * extract property values during CSV serialisation.
098         *
099         * @param clazz the class type parameterised by X that implements Writeable
100         * @throws IllegalArgumentException if clazz is null
101         */
102        public CSVUtil(Class<X> clazz) {
103                this.type = clazz;
104//              this.dt = ReflectionUtils.datatype(clazz);
105                this.methods = Arrays.stream(clazz.getMethods())
106                                .filter(c -> c.isAnnotationPresent(JsonProperty.class))
107                                .toArray(i -> new Method[i]);
108        }
109
110        /**
111         * Creates a stream of field values from the specified object.
112         * <p>
113         * This method provides access to the property values as a stream, allowing
114         * for further stream processing operations. The stream is constructed from
115         * the array of values obtained by invoking annotated methods on the object
116         * instance.
117         *
118         * @param tmp the object instance to extract field values from
119         * @return a stream containing property values in declared order
120         */
121        public Stream<Object> fieldsStream(X tmp) {
122                return Arrays.stream(this.valuesOf(tmp));
123        }
124
125        /**
126         * Generates the CSV header row containing property names.
127         * <p>
128         * The header row is composed of the {@link JsonProperty} annotation values
129         * extracted from all annotated methods in the class.
130         *
131         * @return the CSV header row as a comma-separated string
132         */
133        public String headers() {
134                return Arrays.stream(this.methods)
135                                .map(c -> c.getAnnotation(JsonProperty.class).value())
136                                .collect(Collectors.joining(","));
137        }
138
139//      private static String uncapitalize(String s) {
140//              if (s.startsWith("is")) s = s.substring(2);
141//              if (s.startsWith("get")) s = s.substring(3);
142//        return s.substring(0, 1).toLowerCase() + s.substring(1);
143//    }
144
145        /**
146         * Generates a CSV row from the specified object instance.
147         * <p>
148         * This method extracts property values from the object and converts them to
149         * CSV format.
150         *
151         * @param value the object instance to serialise as a CSV row
152         * @return the object's data formatted as a CSV row
153         * @throws RuntimeException if property access fails during reflection
154         */
155        public String row(X value) {
156                return this.fieldsStream(value).map(o -> csvString(o))
157                                .collect(Collectors.joining(","));
158        }
159
160        /**
161         * Extracts property values from an object instance via reflection.
162         * <p>
163         * This method invokes all methods annotated with {@link JsonProperty} on the
164         * specified object to obtain the corresponding property values. The values
165         * are returned in the same order as the methods array.
166         *
167         *
168         * @param single the object instance to extract values from
169         * @return an array of property values in declaration order
170         * @throws RuntimeException if reflection invocation fails
171         */
172        public Object[] valuesOf(X single) {
173//              if (dt != null) {
174//                      // process using mirror construct.
175//                      return dt.features().stream().map(f -> dt.get(f, single))
176//                                      .toArray();
177//              }
178                Object[] out = new Object[this.methods.length];
179                for (int i = 0; i < this.methods.length; i++) {
180                        try {
181                                out[i] = this.methods[i].invoke(single);
182                        } catch (IllegalAccessException | IllegalArgumentException
183                                        | InvocationTargetException e) {
184                                throw new RuntimeException(e);
185                        }
186                }
187                return out;
188        }
189}
